slides.title: The Interstellar Medium
slides.content:
# The Interstellar Medium (ISM) ðŸŒŒ

The matter between stars.

## Composition

```
By mass:
  ~70% Hydrogen
  ~28% Helium
  ~2% Heavy elements ("metals")
  
Plus: Dust grains (1% by mass but important!)
```

## Phases of the ISM

| Phase | Temperature | Density | State |
|-------|-------------|---------|-------|
| Hot ionized | 10â¶ K | 0.003/cmÂ³ | Plasma |
| Warm ionized | 8,000 K | 0.3/cmÂ³ | Ionized |
| Warm neutral | 6,000 K | 0.5/cmÂ³ | Atomic H |
| Cold neutral | 100 K | 50/cmÂ³ | Atomic H |
| Molecular | 10-20 K | 10Â³-10â¶/cmÂ³ | Hâ‚‚ |

## Interstellar Dust

### Composition
- Silicates (rock-like)
- Carbonaceous (graphite, soot)
- Ice mantles (Hâ‚‚O, CO, COâ‚‚)

### Size
~0.1 Î¼m (1000 atoms across)

### Formation
- Stellar winds
- Supernova ejecta
- Around evolved stars

### Effects
- Extincts (dims) starlight
- Reddens starlight
- Platform for molecule formation

## Chemical Reactions

In space: Too cold and dilute for normal chemistry!

Reactions happen:
- On dust grain surfaces
- Via cosmic ray ionization
- UV photodissociation

> ðŸŽ¯ **Key Point:** Dust grains are essential "chemical factories" in space!

## Why CO as a Tracer?

```
Hâ‚‚ is invisible at low temperatures
Hâ‚‚ has no permanent dipole moment

CO does have a dipole â†’ Rotational lines
CO is abundant â†’ Easy to detect
```

## Famous Molecular Clouds

- Orion Molecular Cloud
- Taurus Molecular Cloud
- Rho Ophiuchi Cloud
- Sagittarius B2 (most molecules detected)

slides.title: Origins of Life Chemistry
slides.content:
# Astrobiology Connections ðŸ§¬

Where did life's molecules come from?

## Building Blocks of Life

| Molecule | Role | Found in Space? |
|----------|------|----------------|
| Amino acids | Proteins | Yes (in meteorites) |
| Sugars | Energy, DNA backbone | Yes (glycolaldehyde) |
| Nucleobases | DNA/RNA | Some evidence |
| Phosphorus compounds | DNA, ATP | Detected |
| Water | Solvent | Abundant! |

## Delivery to Early Earth

```
           Molecular cloud
                 â†“
         Protoplanetary disk
                 â†“
    Comets & asteroids form with organics
                 â†“
         Early Earth bombardment
                 â†“
      Molecules delivered to Earth
```

## Murchison Meteorite (1969)

Fell in Australia, contained:
- 90+ amino acids
- Nucleobases
- Sugar-related compounds
- Fatty acids

> Proof that complex organics form in space!


## Implications

- Life's raw materials are common
- Formed before planets exist
- Similar chemistry could occur elsewhere
